revised_title: Uncommon Anastomoses of Spermatic Vessels in a Woman
tldr: The author, Cromwell Mortimer, describes and illustrates uncommon anastomoses of the spermatic vessels in a woman's body. He discusses the findings from a dissection of a female subject where the anastomoses were large enough to observe the flow of injected substances between the arteries and veins. This study contributes to the understanding of the reproductive system and vascular connections in the human body.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Anatomy
